name: Update Factor VALUE
description: A multiplier determining the amount of learning to perform during each update. Higher values can lead to faster learning but may cause instability.

name: Target Update VALUE
description: The frequency (in steps) at which the target network is updated with the weights of the current network.

name: Soft Update VALUE
description: The factor for soft updates of the target network. A small value means the target network updates slowly, which can stabilize training.

name: Hidden Dimensions VALUE
description: The number of neurons in the hidden layers of the neural network. Larger dimensions can capture more complex patterns but require more computation.
